p.strong: WSO2 Mashup Server in Standalone Mode

li.a: Installing as an NT service using Binary Distribution

body.p: The WSO2 Mashup Server is a powerful yet simple and quick way to tailor Web-based information to the personal needs of individuals and organizations. It is a platform for acquiring data from a variety of sources including Web Services, HTML pages, Feeds and Data sources, and process and combine it with other data using Javascript with E4X XML extensions. The result is then exposed as a new Web service with rich metadata and artifacts to simplify the creation of rich user interfaces.

WSO2 Mashup Server is distributed in several convenient distribution packages, and can be installed either as a standalone server or as part of a J2EE compliant servlet container. WSO2 Mashup Server is distributed under the Apache License, version 2.0.

body.h1: Installing WSO2 Mashup Server in the Standalone Mode
body.p: Note: The WSO2 Mashup Server release has been successfully tested only on Windows XP & Windows 2003 server.
You can use the install.bat file in the Mashup Server distribution to install Mashup Server as a Windows NT service. This installation script is available at CARBON_HOME/bin.

ul.li:
Download
the WSO2 Mashup Server binary distribution.
Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to your Java installation.
From the command prompt run bin/install.bat

body.p: Once you add WSO2 Mashup Server as an NT service to Windows services, you can start this service from Services in Administrative tools of the Control Panel.
Check your WSO2 Mashup Server instance using the URL https://localhost:9443/carbon/

ol.li:
Download
the WSO2 Mashup Server binary distribution.
Extract the zip archive. e.g., unzip wso2mashup-@mashup_version@.zip -d /opt
Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to your Java installation using the export command or by editing /etc/profile. e.g., export JAVA_HOME="/opt/j2sdk"
Execute the WSO2 Mashup Server starting script. e.g., cd /opt/wso2mashup-@mashup_version@/bin; sh wso2server.sh
Check your WSO2 Mashup Server instance using the URL https://localhost:9443/carbon/

body.p: When trying to execute the WSO2 Mashup Server binary from a shell, e.g., /usr/bin/wso2mashup (after WSO2 Mashup Server , v has been installed), if the error message 'Permission denied' pops up, then check the file permission of the run.sh script and set the execution permission.

ul.li: Run the CARBON_HOME/bin/install.bat file and select the unistall option

body.p:
Once WSO2 Mashup Server has been successfully installed, in order to access the Management Console, first start the server, launch a web browser instance, and then point it to the URL https://localhost:9443/carbon/
(if you are using the default settings). This will take you to the "Sign In" page of the Management Console.

Note: By default, WSO2 Mashup Server has two listeners, HTTP and HTTPS. The HTTP listener opens on port 9763, while the HTTPS listener opens on port 9443. The administrator functions are exposed only via the HTTPS port.
For details on WSO2 Mashup Server Management Console see the User Guide
